channel.title: Homes on Damaris Zurell research
channel.description: Recent content in Homes on Damaris Zurell research

item.description: The biodiversity modelling lab I am fascinated by the question why species and individuals are where they are, how they get there and how they manage to sustain. This is central to understanding how they will respond to changes in their abiotic and biotic environment, for example due to climate change. In my team, we tackle research questions across several spatial and temporal scales. For example, we study drivers of broad-scale species distributions, of population dynamics as well as individual fitness, and their interplay with inter- and intraspecific interactions and life-history trade-offs.

item.title: People
item.description: For opportunities to join the lab, please have a look here. Group leader: Damaris Zurell (PhD) - Associate Professor for Ecology/Macroecology at University of Potsdam (tenure track) Administrative assistant: Jennifer Kaminski Technical and research support: Simon Kapitza (M.Sc.) - data base management, biodiversity assessments, socio-economic modelling Postdocs: Guillermo Fandos Guzman (PhD) - BIOPIC project, work package “Understanding how life history and environment shape dispersal in birds” Christian KÃ¶nig (PhD) - BIOPIC project, work package “Understanding how biotic interactions shape species’ niches” Juliane Wolter (PhD) - Individual postdoc project, paleoecology, effects of Arctic vegetation changes on carbon dynamics PhD students:

item.title: Publications
item.description: You can find a full list of my publications here. My ResearcherID is E-2439-2012. You can also find me on ResearchGate and GoogleScholar.

item.title: Teaching
item.description: Teaching materials for practicals: Short course Introduction to the RangeshiftR package - up to date Block course Species distribution modelling - up to date Practicals for MSc module Global change impacts on biodiversity - last updated Feb 2020 Short (half-day) course Introduction to species distribution modelling in R - last updated June 2020 Current teaching: BSc course “Introduction to scientific working in ecology”, Univ. Potsdam MSc module “Macroecology and global change”, Univ.

item.title: Downloads
item.description: You can download some of my codes from my github site. Latest software developments in my team include: an R package for the RangeShifter platform. More info under https://rangeshifter.github.io a Shiny web app introducing and facilitating the usage of the ODMAP protocol for reporting SDM. Check out here: odmap.wsl.ch
